data.title: Whitman's Global Partners
data.meta_description: Descriptions of the global partners that the Whitman School has around the globe.
data.text:
Graduate Business School Network (GBSN)

GBSN's mission is to bring the world’s leading business schools together with businesses, NGOs, and governments to achieve their mission “to improve access to quality, locally relevant management and entrepreneurship education for the developing world.”

It is their work to pursue the mission, and involve members and partners of the network. GBSN describes its work in three broad categories: projects, programs, and thought leadership. Our thought leadership work helps to guide and shape the way management and entrepreneurship education develops—it informs our projects and programs.

European Foundation for Management Development (EFMD)

Founded in 1972, EFMD is a global, non-profit, membership-driven organization dedicated to management development. It is recognized globally as an accreditation body for business schools, programs, and corporate universities.

Their mission is to act as a catalyst to promote and enhance excellence in management development globally.

Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen (China)

The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen (CUHK-SZ) is located in Shenzhen, China, one of the world's foremost innovation hubs. Whitman School partners with the School of Management and Economics at CUHK-SZ for undergraduate student exchange and collaborative Bachelor-Master arrangements to allow qualified CUHK-SZ students to participate in Whitman’s master’s programs.

Institute of Management Technology (India)

Institute of Management Technology (IMT) in Ghaziabad, India is located in India’s national capital region of Delhi. Whitman partners with IMT for graduate student exchange and short-term collaborative programs.

Indian Institute of Management Kashipur (India)

Indian Institute of Management Kashipur (IIM Kashipur), located in Kashipur, India partners with Whitman for collaborative immersion programs and academic collaboration on innovation management.

Paolo de Olavide University of Seville (Spain) and King’s College London (United Kingdom)

Paolo de Olavide University of Seville and King’s College London collaborate with Whitman in global research and other academic activities in entrepreneurship.

Syracuse University World Partners Programs
